name: acquirable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
able to be obtained: According to the law here, residents' rights are only acquirable by residence. The information that you need to complete the application is readily acquirable.
able to be learned: Skills may be transferable, but product knowledge is not usually instantly acquirable. The researchers are looking at whether an aptitude for language is a natural trait or something that is acquirable.
business
  specialized An acquirable business, property, etc. is available be bought: At the time we were the only company in our sector that was publicly traded, and so we were acquirable.
More examplesFewer examplesThe skills needed to carry out these jobs should be acquirable by all.Gender features in the target language are acquirable by language learners even when they are absent in their own language.Urban planners are concerned with how to make sufficient land available and acquirable for development.
